bwwExcerpt: And sure enough, courtesy of director George C. Wolfe's intermittently pleasurable revival of Eugene O'Neill's revered 1946 play, in walks the man himself, Theodore Hickman, known to all as Hickey, and on this occasion portrayed by none other than Denzel Washington. The seedy nest of barflies erupts and so, naturally, does an audience in Broadway's Bernard B. Jacobs Theatre, where the production had its official opening Thursday night.
